page.title: 08TREES
page.content: This is a well wooded area,principally in small spinneys of predominantly deciduous trees,& occasional small plantings of conifers in former parkland. Ash predominates with a fair number of oak,beech & horsechestnut. Where scrub has been allowed to take over,as at Dimminsdale,it is usually silver birch & alder at the water's edge.There are many gaps where elms, lately victims of Dutch Elm Disease, have been felled in copses & hedgerows. Replanting has begun, usually with lime,beech & oak.The oaks of Calke park are of tremendous girth & considerable age & are gradually falling limb from limb.There are plantations of pine at the water's edge of Staunton Harold.
